description: Part one-storey, part two-storey rear extension; roof extension to a rear roofslope; and installation of three upper-floor side-facing windows and six rooflights
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing/plan titles: P18/039/01; P18/039/04; P18/039/05; P18/039/16; P18/039/20; P18/039/21; and P18/039/22.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016). | Any upper-flow window to be located in a wall forming a side elevation of the building must be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Any rooflight to be installed into a roofslope of the building shall be Conservation-style. Details of the proposed Conservation-style rooflight(s) to be used shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of development.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
